div.head: Submitting Content to VSim
div.p: The long-term vision of the project is to build a thriving community of scholars and educators sharing their 3D content and leveraging existing and new academic modeling work for broad educational use through a project repository and archive focused on the real-time explorations of reconstruction of historic urban environments. Contributors must be registered users before they can submit to the archive. (Registration is free.)
Unregistered User: Anyone can download VSim and content from the archive without registering as a user.

General User: Users must be registered in order to upload VSim narratives, embedded resource files, and archival content to the community collections. We encourage the community to share resources and narratives through related repositories.

Content Contributor/Creator: General users must request permission to upgrade their account to ‘Content Contributor/Creator’ so that they can submit their own models and projects to the Repository and Archive. Access is granted on a case by case basis by the Digital Library Program and the Institute for Digital Research and Education. Submission requests for models and projects will be vetted for their academic rigor and educational contribution to the community. To request an upgrade, e-mail vsim@library.ucla.edu with your full name, institutional affiliation, a short description of the project and/or model (approximately 800 words), and a bibliography of resources that informed the construction of the model and guided the project. Requests may take up to a week to approve.

Once registered as Content Contributor/Creators, users can submit a project to the archive. The submission process involves completion of the project metadata form, and uploading a ‘hero’ image to be used as the project thumbnail. Once created, projects can store collections of models, VSim files, and other project related resources. See “File Types” to learn more about what can be stored and shared through the VSim archive. The final steps of the submission process involve licensing agreements for rights and distribution. (We encourage the use of Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike (CC BY-NC-SA) license.)
To start your project submission, click the SUBMIT PROJECT button at the top of this page.
Most electronic formats can be placed in VSim. Project resources are divided into three different collections: Models, Archives, and Submissions.

Models: The models collections houses VSim file types as well as many popular model file types. The VSim file formats include binary model files (.vsim), individual narrative files (.nar), and individual embedded resource files (.ere).

Archives: The archives collection is for all other project-related files. From project notes, to static images, to final documentation or publication documents, the archive can hold whatever additional files you would like to offer the user community to better understand and utilize your project models. These files can also help other users customize their own VSim narratives and embedded resources for the project model.

list.item: Other resources include: .pdf, .jpeg, .jpg, .tif, .png, .cad, .doc, .docx, .mp4, .mpg, .csv, .ppt, .tar, .zip, .kml (basically any file type that supports your project)

div.p: Contact us if you have questions about submitting content, preferred file formats, and inclusion of previously published content in an open access repository.
